name: Nuno J. Mamede
content: Nuno Mamede - HLT@INESC-ID Nuno Mamede From HLT@INESC-ID Nuno J. MamedeProfessor Associado | SA-HLT E31E-332E-A259 0000-0001-6033-158X 7Kou6lkAAAAJ C-5555-2008 6602527446 +351213100300     232 nuno.mamede@inesc-id.pt www.l2f.inesc-id.pt/wiki/index.php/Nuno_Mamede Nuno Mamede graduated in Electrotechnical and Computers Engineering from the Instituto Superior Técnico (IST), Lisbon, in 1981, and received his MSc and Ph.D. degrees in Electrotechnical and Computers Engineering, from the same University in 1985 and 1992, respectively. In 1982 he started as a lecturer and since 2006 he holds the position of Associate Professor at Instituto Superior Técnico, where he has taught Digital Systems, Object Oriented Programming, Programming Languages, knowledge representation, and Natural Language Processing. He has been a researcher at INESC-ID Lisboa, in Lisbon, since its creation in 1980. He participated in the foundation of L2F where he held a position in the Executive Board. His activities have been in the areas of Written Natural Language Processing, namely on Syntactic Processing, Named Entity Recognition, and Natural Language Interfaces to Data Bases. He has authored a significant number of scientific papers. He is a member of AAAI, ACM and ACL.Research Interests: Written Natural Language Processing Named Entity Recognition Time Expression normalization Dialog systems Total Publications: 183Article (Author)Exploring Few-Shot Approaches to Automatic Text Complexity Assessment in European PortugueseEugénio Ribeiro, David Antunes, Nuno J.
